page.title: 07DARTMOUTH FIRE SERVICE
page.content: { Dartmouth fire service}started to use a new station in June 1984. The old station was next to the police station in Mayors Avenue. There are 24 firemen. They are all retained which means they have other jobs. The station officer is Terry Millman. He has been a fireman for 26 years and station officer for 3 years. Dartmouth fire service have two {'Dennis'}fire engines, they have had one for ten years and one for five years. The numbers of the engines are 241 and 242. Dartmouth fire service at times of {drought}usually get their water from the river. In{1984}there were{122}fire calls which averages 2 calls a week. The strangest fire Terry has attended was when a lady had tried to warm her bed with an iron.
